columns.aid: Unique identifier for each aircraft in the database.
columns.name: The model name of the aircraft.
columns.distance: The maximum distance the aircraft can travel without refueling.

aircraft.table_description: The aircraft table stores information about various aircraft models, their unique identifiers, and their travel capabilities.

columns.eid: Represents the unique identifier for each employee associated with the certificate.
columns.aid: Represents the unique identifier for each aircraft associated with the certificate.

certificate.table_description: The certificate table serves to associate employees with aircraft, indicating which employee holds a certificate to operate or manage specific aircraft.

columns.eid: A unique identifier assigned to each employee.
columns.name: The full name of the employee.
columns.salary: The annual salary of the employee.

employee.table_description: The employee table holds essential information about employees, including their unique ID, name, and salary.

columns.flno: The unique identifier for each flight.
columns.origin: The airport or city from which the flight departs.
columns.destination: The airport or city to which the flight is arriving.
columns.distance: The total distance, in miles, between the origin and destination.
columns.departure_date: The date and time at which the flight is scheduled to depart.
columns.arrival_date: The date and time at which the flight is scheduled to arrive.
columns.price: The cost of a ticket for the flight.
columns.aid: The identifier for the aircraft assigned to the flight.

flight.table_description: The flight table contains records of individual flights, detailing their origins, destinations, distances, schedules, pricing, and associated aircraft.
